column5: HAMD-Hamilton Depressive Rating ScaleNote: The descriptions of line items were taken from the HAMD-17 due to it being most common in the dataset. The 21, 24, and 28 were matched up with corresponding line items and then remaining questions were tacked onto the end and indicated by question description.
HAMD item 6Insomnia-early hours of the morning
HAMD item 20*Taken from HAMD 21 scale*Paranoid symptoms
HAMD item 21*Taken from HAMD 21 scale*Obsessional/compulsive symptoms
HAMD item 26Helplessness(taken from UCSD 28 item HAMD)
HAMD item 27Hopelessness(taken from UCSD 27 item HAMD)
HAMD item 28Worthlessness(taken from UCSD 28 item HAMD)
Clinical global impression-severity of illnessRange: 0-7 (higher value, more ill)
CGI score-Overall symptom severity/severity of illness

Social and Occupational Functioning Assessment ScaleRange: 0-100(100 represents greater functioning/health)The SOFAS is a new scale that differs from the Global Assessment of Functioning (GAF) Scale in that it focusesexclusively on the individual's level of social and occupational functioning and is not directly influenced by the overallseverity of the individual's psychological symptoms. Also in contrast to the GAF Scale, any impairment in social andoccupational functioning that is due to general medical conditions is considered in making the SOFAS rating. The SOFASis usually used to rate functioning for the current period (i.e., the level of functioning at the time of the evaluation).The SOFAS may also be used to rate functioning for other time periods. For example, for some purposes it may beuseful to evaluate functioning for the past year (i.e., the highest level of functioning for at least a few months duringthe past year).Consider social and occupational functioning on a continuum from excellent functioning to grossly impaired functioning.Include impairments in functioning due to physical limitations, as well as those due to mental impairments. To becounted, impairment must be a direct consequence of mental and physical health problems; the effects of lack ofopportunity and other environmental limitations are not to be considered.
column117: Social and Occupational Functioning Assessment Scale (SOFAS)

column129: Scoring:  Positive Affect Score: Add the scores on items 1, 3, 5, 9, 10,  12, 14, 16, 17, and 19. Scores can  range from 10 - 50, with higher scores representing higher  levels of positive affect.  Mean Scores: 33.3 (SD±7.2)  Negative Affect Score: Add the scores on items 2, 4, 6, 7, 8,  11, 13, 15, 18, and 20. Scores can  range from 10 - 50, with lower scores representing lower  levels of negative affect.  Mean Score: 17.4 (SD ± 6.2)

Depression band harmonized from HAMD and MADRS:MADRAS calculation: 0-6=1, 7-19=2, 20-34=3, 35-60=4HAMD calculation: ge 0 and le 7 then dep_band=1ge 8 and le 16 then dep_band=2ge 17 and le 23 then dep_band=3ge 24 and le 50(can also just be greater than 24) then dep_band=4HAMD 17 & 28 were used for harmonizing according to BW notesIDSC sum: ? 13=1/absent14-23=2/mild24-38=3/moderate? 39=4/severe
column126: 1 absent  2 mild  3 moderate  4 severe
column129: Depression band harmonized from HAMD and MADRS:    MADRAS calculation:  0-6=1,  7-19=2,  20-34=3,  35-60=4  HAMD calculation:  ge 0 and le 7 then dep_band=1  ge 8 and le 16 then dep_band=2  ge 17 and le 23 then dep_band=3  ge 24 and le 50(can also just be greater than 24) then  dep_band=4  HAMD 17 & 28 were used for harmonizing according to  BW notes  IDSC sum:  ≤ 13=1/absent  14-23=2/mild  24-38=3/moderate  ≥ 39=4/severe

column5: Depression band harmonized from HAMD, MADRAS, and CESD total scores. Cutoffs used for the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale were no depression (0?7); mild to moderate depression (8?23); and severe depression (?24).17 Although there have been various suggestions on how to cross-walk the MADRS with other symptom severity measures, 18,19 for this analysis, cutoffs used for the MADRS were no depression (0?6); mild to moderate depression (7?34); and severe depression (?35).20?22   Finally, for the CESD the cutoffs used were no depression (0-15); mild to moderate depression (16 to 27); and severe depression (?28). 23IDSC scores:? 13=0/absent14-23=1/mild ? 24=2/moderate/severe
column126: None = 0  Mild-moderate = 1  Severe = 2

column5: Depression band harmonized from HAMD, MADRAS, and CESD total scores. USE for analysis because executive decisions were made regarding discrepancies. Cutoffs used for the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale were no depression (0?7); mild to moderate depression (8?23); and severe depression (?24).17 Although there have been various suggestions on how to cross-walk the MADRS with other symptom severity measures, 18,19 for this analysis, cutoffs used for the MADRS were no depression (0?6); mild to moderate depression (7?34); and severe depression (?35).20?22   Finally, for the CESD the cutoffs used were no depression (0-15); mild to moderate depression (16 to 27); and severe depression (?28). IDSC scores:? 13=0/absent14-23=1/mild ? 24=2/moderate/severe
column129: Depression band harmonized from HAMD, MADRAS, and  CESD total scores. USE for analysis because executive  decisions were made regarding discrepancies.  Cutoffs used for the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale  were no depression (0−7); mild to moderate depression  (8−23); and severe depression (≥24).17 Although there  have been various suggestions on how to cross-walk the  MADRS with other symptom severity measures, 18,19 for  this analysis, cutoffs used for the MADRS were no  depression (0−6); mild to moderate depression (7−34); and  severe depression (≥35).20−22 Finally, for the CESD the  cutoffs used were no depression (0-15); mild to moderate  depression (16 to 27); and severe depression (≥28).

column5: Cardiovascular comorbidityAreas it includes: Heart, Vascular, HemtopoieticPossible examples: Congenital heart defects (chd), heart attack, angina,afib,atherosclerosis,coronary insufficiency,congestive heart failure,cardiomyopathy,intermittent claudication,left vent hypertrophy, angina pectoris, cardiac dysrhythmia, angioplasty, bypass, myocardial infarction (MI), Arrhythmia, Coronary (CAD),  Hypertension (HTN), Hypercholesterolemia, hyperlipidemia,stroke, hypercholesterolemia, cardiovascular disease, leg/abdomen vein disorder, anneurysm, high triglycerides, Dyslipidemia, Anemia

Respiratory comorbidityAreas it includes: Respiratory, ENT + eyes, larynxExamples:COPD, asthma , chronic bronchitis, emphysema, eyes ears nose throat,periodontal,vision,hearing, allergies/hay fever, allergy, Obstructive sleep apnea, glaucoma

Gastrointestinal comorbidityAreas it includes: Upper GI, Lower, GI Examples: Diseases of digestive system: upper gi,celiac,IBS, gastric or duodenal ulcer, bloating/constipation, gastro-intestinal reflux, gastric lymphoma, lower gi, ulcerative colitis, crohn's disease, Colon Cancer, diverticulitis
Hepatic/Pancreatic comorbidityAreas it includes: Liver/pancreas/biliaryExamples: liver: liver cirrhosis,  Hepatitis C, hepatitis (no subtype specified)
Renal comorbidityAreas it includes: RenalExamples: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Stage 1 (90); 2(60-89); 3 (30-59); 4 or 5 (<30), renal, Nephrotoxicity (lithium), renal insufficiency
GU(genito-urinary) comorbidityAreas it includes: GUExamples: genitourinary, Prostatic hypertrophy

Musculoskeletal comorbidityAreas it includes: Musculoskeletal and skinExamples: diseases of musculoskeletal system:cystic acne, musculoskeletal conditions ,fibromyalgia, arthritis, rheumatoid disorder, lupus, eczema, rheumatoid arthritis, back/spine problems, orteomuscular (osteomuscular conditions), Fibromyalgia, Obesity, Osteoporosis

Endocrine comorbidityAreas it includes: Endrocrine/breastExamples: graves disease, hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism, diabetes, diseases of thyroid gland, irregular periods, PCOS,menopausal symptoms, fertility problems, high blood glucose or insulin resistance, Type I diabetes, Type II diabetes, Breast cancer, glucose intolerance

Other medical comorbidity? Includes unspecified cancers, medical conditions that have a diagnosis, care plan, etc.. random description of pain like 'back spasms' doesn't qualify as a comorbidity.0=no other comorbidities
MMSE-Mini Mental State Exam Total Score(0-30)
